newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Telebras second most active foreign stock in US.
newsitem.headline: Telebras second most active foreign stock in US.

text.p: Brazilian state telecoms group Telebras shares were the second most actively traded among foreign firms on U.S. stock exchanges in 1996, financial newspaper Gazeta Mercantil said on Monday.
In its first year of trade on the New York Stock Exchange, trade in Telebras was worth $26.8 billion, it said. The first most active foreign company was Royal Dutch Petroleum, with $90 million more.
Gazeta Mercantil also said trades in American Depositary Receipts (ADRs) surged last year, totalling $345 billion, 25 percent more than in 1995.
